ul.li: There are nodes synchronized on ENM.
The ENM user must have read rights for Topology Browser.

context.p: The Attribute Details are displayed in the panel to the right of Topology Tree. The Details panel shows the current property values of the selected Managed Object (MO).

li.xref: View Attributes in the Details Panel

step.cmd: View Attributes in the Details Panel

info.p:
It is possible to view both the Persistent and Non-Persistent attributes of a selected Managed Object (MO).
Click an object on the topology tree.
Click the Details button located in the Action Bar. It is designated with an 'i' icon. A sliding panel will appear detailing the attributes of the selected object.

ul.li: To view which attributes can be edited, click the Edit Attributes button.
To exit the editable view mode click the Cancel link.
Enter a partial (from the beginning) or full property name.
Continue typing, and notice that the properties are narrowed.

info.p: The Node Details TAB displays the Synchronization State, IP address, Management State, Network Functions, Radio Access Technology, and Collection details of the node associated with the selected MO.

ul.li: Select an MO in the topology tree below the SubNetwork level.
Select the Node Details Tab in the Details Panel
Node Details TAB is not present for SubNetworks, as these contain multiple nodes which can have independent and potentially different Synchronization States.
The Synchronization State can also be viewed on the topology tree for node-level MO's as described in the Topology Tree.

In the case of collection details, the complete hierarchy can be viewed if the object belongs to Transport Topology Type Collections. However, if a node belongs to a Non-Transport Topology Collection, only the direct collection or parent collection of the node is shown.
